revised_title: Hot Ductility and Sulphur Segregation in 1 %C-1 %Cr Steels
tldr: This study investigates the hot ductility and sulphur segregation in 1 %C-1 %Cr steels. Hot torsion tests were conducted on three steels with varying Mn:S ratios. The results showed that the ductility depended on the Mn:S ratio and the grain size. Thermodynamic data and elemental analysis revealed that the sulphur concentration and coverage on grain boundaries were higher in steel C compared to steel A. The segregated sulphur levels correlated closely with the hot ductility results, indicating that the Mn:S ratio's effect on hot ductility is mainly due to the embrittling influence of sulphur.
